Ever watch a horror movie and say "what is that person doing, no don't go up those stairs."? Well then this game is for you! All included with "don't go out that front door." Also ever wish someone would die because they are asking for it? Now you too can make that happen. ahha. All in all it's a fun game, to live in all the horror stories we watched growing up. Very fun solo as a killer and super fun with a group of buds up late at 2am and jumping at little sounds. (:

Although fun in the past, DBD has been going downhill over the years. Rampant hacking and unbalanced gameplay have ruined so many matches and I can't recommend this to anyone. The only thing thing holding this game up anymore is the content creators. This game is in desperate need of a health chapter, similar to what Rainbow Six: Siege had done in the past.

This is a great and fun game to play with friends! My only gripe is that if there is a mechanic to stop survivors from camping in certain spots, there should also be one for killers who camp certain spots. If a survivor is camping for too long in one place, crows appear. But for the killer? They can get away with it, and it feels a bit unfair and off-balanced. There should be equal punishment for camping.

It is become too toxic. Instead of making a balanced game, the devs chose to listen to the nagging survivors and planted tens of pallets. As a killer, all I can do is chase the survivors from one pallet to the other. It is become running in circles with many obstacles that make it impossible to hit the survivors who enjoy highly functional field of vision and mobility.
